mdRecord.dcterms:title: Museum - Case #3
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Exhibit case in the museum displaying primarily ceramics and glassware including a Society of the Cincinnati soup plate [W-483], a set of 6 jelly glasses [W-522], several small lacquer dressing boxes and a wax portrait of George Washington [W-517]. The Museum (1928-2006) was built along the north lane between the spinning house and the greenhouse slave quarters in 1928. It replaced the Relic House which occupied the nearby salt house from 1923-1928. When the Donald W. Reynolds Museum, built underground, opened in 2006, the space was repurposed as the Interpretive Center.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Mount Vernon Black and White Film Collection
